Detailed Description

Definition at line 1283 of file AbsListWidget.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
SCROLL_STATE_IDLE 

The view is not scrolling.

Note navigating the list using the trackball counts as being in the idle state since these transitions are not animated.

SCROLL_STATE_TOUCH_SCROLL 

The user is scrolling using touch, and their finger is still on the screen.

SCROLL_STATE_FLING 

The user had previously been scrolling using touch and had performed a fling.

The animation is now coasting to a stop

int32_t  firstVisibleItem,
int32_t  visibleItemCount,
int32_t  totalItemCount 
) [pure virtual]

Callback method to be invoked when the list or grid has been scrolled.

This will be called after the scroll has completed

Parameters:
viewThe view whose scroll state is being reported
firstVisibleItemthe index of the first visible cell (ignore if visibleItemCount == 0)
visibleItemCountthe number of visible cells
totalItemCountthe number of items in the list adaptor
virtual void gaia::ui::AbsListWidgetOnScrollListener::onScrollStateChanged ( AbsListWidget *  pWidget,
int32_t  scrollState 
) [pure virtual]

Callback method to be invoked while the list view or grid view is being scrolled.

If the view is being scrolled, this method will be called before the next frame of the scroll is rendered. In particular, it will be called before any calls to widget.provider#getView(int, View, ViewGroup).

Parameters:
viewThe view whose scroll state is being reported
scrollStateThe current scroll state. One of SCROLL_STATE_IDLE, SCROLL_STATE_TOUCH_SCROLL or SCROLL_STATE_IDLE.
